str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
After, when, as soon as. From epi and an; a particle of indefinite contemporaneousness; whenever, as soon as.
Strong (originally and generally of physical strength); mighty, powerful, vehement, sure. From ischus; forcible.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From epi and erchomai; to supervene, i.e. Arrive, occur, impend, attack, influence.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To conquer, be victorious, overcome, prevail, subdue. From nike; to subdue.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Complete armor, panoply. From a compound of pas and hoplon; full armor.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Feminine Singular
Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From dia and didomi; to give throughout a crowd, i.e. Deal out; also to deliver over.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Spoil taken from a foe. Neuter from skullo; something stripped, i.e. Booty.
